result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul E. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription, comply with prescription appropriately and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  No contact w/victim, victims family, residence or business.  3 days jail credit to be applied if probation is revoked.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Paul E. Anderson in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties recv'd PSI report.  Parties agree with probation and argue jail sentence. Defense read VIS.  Court withholds sentence.

Sentencing hearing on June 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Paul E. Anderson in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  State and Attorney Middleton request PSI.  Attorney Middleton agrees.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI ordered and to be completed by June 3, 2015.  Sentencing to be set thereafter.

Defendant Paul E. Anderson appeared by video means with Attorney Raabe. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller with Rick S. appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Defendant has qualified for PD.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $2000.00 cash bond.  Attorney Raabe argues bond.  Time limits waived. $150.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of any firearms, whether loaded or unloaded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
